website_summaries.verdict: This lawn roller boasts the capacity and weight of steel in a rust-resistant and cost-effective polyurethane package, making it the best of both worlds.
pros: Features a 36-inch, 76-gallon drum that weighs 690 pounds when filled with water
Perfect for repairing imperfections in large yards due to frost, mole hills, or erosion
Easy to fill with wide-mouth opening and wears rounded drum ends to avoid lawn damage
Features handy scraper bar to keep roller free from debris
cons: May be too heavy for some lawn tractors to pull when filled and cannot be pushed by hand

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately after using twice the thin pieces of metal that hold the roller onto the towbar have broken off. They have broke after making a reasonable turn going slow. We need a replacement part but don’t know how to contact the seller
customer_reviews.author: J.L.

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought the PRT-36BH 690 lb and it was light enough for me to move empty. As others have said, the bar did not fully clear the roller at first because the roller was slightly warped. The bar was pretty easy to bend though and the warping does not change results. The cap does not need to screw all the way in - you just need to go far enough to make it water tight so others' comments about it not tightening all the way were irrelevant, in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy L.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I like it. We have a private baseball field. We graded the field and planted turf by seed in October. Over the winter the soil settled and we had lumps, highs, and low spots develop. These would create some very "bad hops" and could injure kids. After the heavy spring rain, we allowed the soil do drain out a bit and pulled the roller with a garden tractor. It helped tremendously to lower the high spots. it needs to be done several times. Best to wait a few days till after a good rain.
customer_reviews.author: Sports Book Fanatic

customer_reviews.title: POOR QUALITY HARDWARE
customer_reviews.text: Received this product as expected. Assembled it in about 15 min; pulled it 30 feet, made a u-turn and both E clamps flew off. I was able to locate one of them, but had to rig up a temporary fix for the other side. See photo. I am seriously considering a return after seeing what Brinly customer service has to say. I would expect much stronger hardware for something that must be able to handle 690 lbs. I would not purchase again with the same hardware. I will update after my response from Brinly.
customer_reviews.author: Kendrick Brown

customer_reviews.title: Mole Tunnel Flattening Power
customer_reviews.text: I bought this roller this past Spring to flatten out mole tunnels that seemed to be everywhere in my yard. Assembly was easy. I filled it up with water and my 24hp lawn tractor had little difficulty pulling it around the yard. Do be careful on hills, as this roller is very heavy, and I did get stuck going up a steep section of yard where the tractor started slipping, and I had to unhook the roller and re-orient the tractor so it was not going straight up the hill. The roller flattened out all of the tunnels nicely. Storage is easy once you drain the water. I hang it on the wall of my barn.
customer_reviews.author: BoylermanCT

customer_reviews.title: Contemplating a return
customer_reviews.text: This thing didn’t make it once around my yard before I lost an E ring. The E ring holds the bar assembly onto the roller drum. Surely there is a better quality option to achieve this than this flimsy clip.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Mello

customer_reviews.title: I used my lawnmower instead of my ATV
customer_reviews.text: This works great! I was unsure having purchased another “professional “ version from a BIG BOX store, only to have the hub fall apart after one use. This pulls easily and is very effective on my 3 acres. I have two neighbors that already want to borrow it, because they see my yard. I used my lawnmower instead of my ATV for smoother turns, and had no strain even on the hill.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Sue Means

customer_reviews.title: It is very easy to tow up and down hills
customer_reviews.text: Assembly couldn't have been easier. It is very easy to tow up and down hills, but side ways on wet grass it wants to slides down and take the lawn tractor backwards with it. After filling the drum with cold water, the sun warms the drum and it expands in the center to rub the scraper bar really bad. So I took it off, bent it out quiet a bit than put it back on, now all is well.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Williams

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!  Worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: Filled mine with water and got the lawn rolled, worked perfect. Built solid and this will last many years.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia F

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Only used once so far but meets my expectations. Have drained the water after use to avoid the flattening issues others mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: mdavis

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to assemble. Works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: All you need is a 13mm socket wrench and about 15 minutes. The nuts, bolts and washers are all prepackaged by assembly step. Zero confusion. Only "issue", as you can see in the pics, is the container was a bit warped, but it wasn't a big deal at all. It still made full rotations without issue and you're not trying to win any races when pulling it.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander S Epperson

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job
customer_reviews.text: Well packed. Super easy instructions and assembly. Does its job.
customer_reviews.author: Tedward

customer_reviews.title: Hardware (not) included
customer_reviews.text: The hardware which is supposed to be with the roller was missing. I had to go to two hardware stores to get each piece I needed.
customer_reviews.author: RaysView

customer_reviews.title: A great roller for money
customer_reviews.text: This roller really did the job. It was easy to put together. I like the rolled edges, as it does not make marks in the lawn. It IS HEAVY. I use a 4 wheeler to pull it; so I am not sure about a lawn mower being able to do the job. It made an immediate difference in the "potholes" in my lawn and made the next mowings much smoother. I would definitely buy one of these again, given what I have experienced so far.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Looks good
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used the unit yet. It looks very good. but I won't use it until it stops freezing at night. I remember reading a review about a portion of the hitch rubbing the drum. Same thing when I assembled it but It may be that there is some function for this as it might screed off mud that might accumulate on the drum circumference. If not, it would be very easy to fix. JOHN
customer_reviews.author: John Wilham

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job but front bar rubs
customer_reviews.text: If your going to roll your lawn you need a roller that's got the weight the job done. This one's definitely a heavy weight. Would have given it a 5 star but the cross bar rubs on the front of the roller . I'm not sure how to bend it out to avoid it wearing down the plastic drum.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: It might leak immediately
customer_reviews.text: This is a photo immediately after assembly and filling it up with water... Amazon has replaced it. And I am waiting my return, hoping it doesnt have a hole in it out of the box.. But was rather disappointed to find this defect as I needed to use it on a home project the day it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Rian Winter

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: I think if you need a lawn roller this is a good one to get. 690 pounds sounds like a lot, but it is probably the least amount needed to do a good job. It would probably be best to use this a day or so after a rain for best results.
customer_reviews.author: Gary R. Bass

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Light when empty. Works well. Easy to fill easy to empty
customer_reviews.author: LINDA MCKEE

customer_reviews.title: Crummy
customer_reviews.text: This roller is just of poor quality. The bar are not strong enough for the weight of the roller. One pass on a corner and the broke! I tried to contact the company and Plumstruck said it was not there problem.
customer_reviews.author: L356

customer_reviews.title: Just As I Anticipated
customer_reviews.text: I received my roller in great time and the box was intact with all of the fasteners easily found. It only took a few minutes to put the roller together and was quite easy. Knowing that these rollers do deform a bit, I filled it with water and was not suprised when it deformed a bit and rubbed slightly on the mud scraper bar. Rolling your yard should be done with the ground wet, but I was knocking down some mole runs just fine with my 17 horsepower Craftsman while I was cutting my grass. All in all the roller works very good and I prefer it to my old steel roller.
customer_reviews.author: Warne Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Looks good. Easy to Fill and pull
customer_reviews.text: Looks good. Easy to Fill and pull. Handle is well made and one part of it is very close to the rotating drum which peels off dirt, etc.
customer_reviews.author: DCHASS

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: It's doing an ok job compacting and leveling. I keep the water in the roller so that I don't go through 100dreds of gallons of water when I use the roller multiple times early in the year. The challenge is that the roller needs to be stored with the plug on the upper end or it will leak. Now the roller has a flat spot on the other side. The next time I will get a steel roller.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Very poor!!
customer_reviews.text: Had trouble with the threading!!! Very poor!!! 10 min. to assemble, 2 hrs. trying to thread on filler cap!!
customer_reviews.author: anthony siliano

customer_reviews.title: For Compacting
customer_reviews.text: Works well with my 14 horse Case tractor. I should have done more homework on this. It compacts what it goes over. Its purpose is not for leveling bumpy lawns. My lesson is learned and hope this is of help to someone else. Leveling is filling the low spots or making use of equipment for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Russell E. Nace

customer_reviews.title: Is it heavy enough for what I am looking for, Yes
customer_reviews.text: Had a small leak the first time I used it. They were bringing me a replacement in a couple of days and did.
customer_reviews.author: Patty  Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: But still a good product I would recommend
customer_reviews.text: After pulling about 6 acres had modify for actual bearing the plastic bearing would not hold up... Needs a slight design change. But still a good product I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works like it should.
customer_reviews.text: Works like it should and pulls nicely behind the garden tractor. If you have a small tractor you might have trouble if you fill it completely.
customer_reviews.author: BC Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: Quick shipping, easy to assemble and works extremely well on mole tunnels. Plug is hard to put in but just make sure you start it by hand to insure proper alignment.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M Tradewell

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. Holds a lot of water and is heavy enough to do the job. I actually let some water out to lighten it up a little. Make sure your tractor can handle it. I have a 17hp and she struggled a little going up a slight grade. Quality construction and very light when it's empty.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: no complaints
customer_reviews.text: works like it should, easy to fill and empty, I think it's a keeper. okay,it's a roller, what's more to say.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry B

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Second one the screw cap filler has been stripped since I received.
customer_reviews.author: Viper

customer_reviews.title: I've had it for a year now and am glad I got it
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I've had it for a year now and am glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: AVence

customer_reviews.title: good but difficult drain
customer_reviews.text: great roller but drain plug goes in and out very hard-need to use wrench. Does a great job with the extra weight.
customer_reviews.author: Carl A. Glaza

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: You need a pipe wrench to put on and take off the plug
customer_reviews.author: wendy l williams

customer_reviews.title: As advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product and performed as advertised. Easy assembled, and up in running in 20 minutes. I've only used it once so far, but will use it periodically throughout the season. It did a great job flattening the numerous mole tunnels throughout my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Sissy

customer_reviews.title: preferably after a good soaking rain
customer_reviews.text: works but the ground needs to be very wet, preferably after a good soaking rain. Otherwise, the plastic deforms and does not level the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Penner

customer_reviews.title: barrel is a little out of round and rubs bar ...
customer_reviews.text: barrel is a little out of round and rubs bar, had to bend a small bow into bar for it to clear.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The plug and receiving threads were stripped and I have not been able to get the plug to fit.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Much better than a previous one from another company.
customer_reviews.text: This is built well and easy to put together. Mine came with a damaged package and I had to re-bend one of the bars back into shape but other than that it is a worthwhile purchase. My last one had a rubber expanding plug that popped out, a lot. Pros: Stout frame, threaded fill/drain plug, very thick wall. Cons: Poor packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Ken S.

customer_reviews.title: I'm impressed
customer_reviews.text: Took some time to put together, 45 min. Durable and easy to move around with my Sears 20 hp yard tractor. Excellent delivery time, quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it once, so can't say a lot. It was easy to assemble. Made in the USA. It was as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The roller was defective out of the box. They ...
customer_reviews.text: The roller was defective out of the box. They quickly sent me 3 more. No extra charge and they are not defective. What Do I do with the extras?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Assembly was quick and easy. Had to call mfg once to confirm plug doesn't screw in more than 2 turns and to gently bend the scraper bar so it didn't touch drum. Had it together in 15-20 min.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Schreur

customer_reviews.title: Well built roller and tank will not rust. Easy to hook up
customer_reviews.text: nice roller for the money at a very good price. easy to handle and easy to store. Will not rust
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly what I was looking and the price was right
customer_reviews.author: constance j scott

customer_reviews.title: It's just okay!
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually write reviews for items I've purchased, in this case I'm making an exception. After one use the roller lost it's shape! It now has a giant flat spot from sitting one night in warm temperatures! In fairness to Brinly I have not contacted them about this. If you buy it, I would suggest draining the water immediately after use. It is easy to put together, the plug, as others have mentioned only goes in a couple of turns which is good enough.
customer_reviews.author: doc

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I knew that this was a bit of pricepoint product, but its too expensive to be disposible, yet too cheaply made to be useful. Fell apart halfway around the first lap on my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the Lawn Roller
customer_reviews.text: We have a 4 acre lot that was originally a potato field. We have worked long hours to turn that into a nice lawn area. We still had some patches that were rough and needed a roller to help smooth that out. This product worked great, easily pulls behind the 4-wheeler and when empty is very light and easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: Scott L. Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I looked at many steel rollers but they all had the same problems...they dent and rust out from the inside out! Even the displays in the stores had badly dented rollers. None of the steel rollers I saw had a scraping bar to clean off any clinging dirt or clay. My only regret is that this roller is not available in a heavier weight poly and a larger diameter, maybe 30 inches to get more weight and leveling power. All in all, this is my choice as a great roller. Forget steel if you have any rocks or gravel in the soil you want to roll.
customer_reviews.author: James Y

product_meta.title: Brinly PRT-36BH 690-Pound Tow Behind Poly Lawn Roller, 24 by 36-Inch
product_meta.description: Tow-behind lawn rollers are ideal Tractor attachments for erasing damage & helping establish new growth for a perfect, healthy lawn. Before planting new grass seed, lawn rollers (also called sod rollers & yd. rollers) can help level uneven ground. After seeding, rolling helps speed up germination by ensuring that seeds make contact with the soil. Use a water-filled lawn Roller to help new sod get established, removing air pockets & ensuring the roots make contact. If rodents & insects have damaged your grass, A lawn Roller helps smooth The lawn for uniformity. Indiana-based briny-hardy company has been manufacturing quality lawn & garden attachments since 1839 taking the work out of DIY yd. maintenance only gets more effortless with each Brinley product in our broad line of durable attachments. The best yd. require the best tools-- get a yd. like the pros with Brinley!
feature_bullets: Ideal for large yards: 36" Rolling width and 690 lb. Capacity is perfect for larger yards or bigger greenspaces - covering more ground for quicker results. Perfect tool for erasing lawn damage from moles and frost, or packing down loose dirt, seed, or sod.

76 gallon capacity: The heaviest and most powerful in the Brinley line, this roller holds up to 76 gallons (690 lbs. ) of water or sand. It is both rugged enough to withstand towing behind a tractor and light enough to easily move and store when empty.
Durable construction: Sturdy poly roller drum won't dent or rust, and resists weather damage for use season after season. Measures 36" In width.
Faster filling: includes fill opening with extra-large diameter to expedite filling and emptying of the drum. Can be easily filled with a garden hose.
No hassle Storage: when you're finished rolling your lawn, simply drain and hang this compact roller in your garage or shed to occupy minimal space. Empty roller is lightweight for easy transport.
